flowRoot.flowPara: -1) PolyA+ selection (30A or more on average)
1) mRNA -> RNA/DNA using a poly(T) primer.
This primer can land anywhere in the poly(A) tail, so that transcripts with short and long poly(A) tails are captured.
3) DNA/DNA + sequencing adapter (that bind) + PCR primers (that dont bind)

text.tspan: RNA + dT primer 3' in poly(A) tail
RNA + dT primer 5' in poly(A) tail
Reverse transcription + DNA polymeration + RNA degradation by RNAse H

flowRoot.flowPara: Add A to 3' ends + sequencing adapters + PCR primers

text.tspan: 15-20 rounds of PCR that somehow keeps the above format
Q: what happens to the I and W? Don't they get copied?
A: the primer is not part of the 'dangling' end. Still,
you will get the other dangling part. You still need verification of these detais.
The two 5' ends bind to the surface -- hopefully far enough apart
that their clusters don't overlap when fully grown
